subject: Re: [junit] No runnable methods exceptions using JUNIT 4.0 TestSuite with eclipse 3.2.1
msgSnippet: Hello, there is a small mix up here between Junit3.8 and 4.x First of all if you are using the JUnit 4.x then the framework.Test and TestSuite classes are not
messageBody:
Hello,

there is a small mix up here between Junit3.8 and 4.x

First of all if you are using the JUnit 4.x then the framework.Test and TestSuite classes are not recognized any more. however, you can make this run using a special runner i.e AllTests. Use the @RunWith() for this. Then the Test and Testsuite are loaded by Junit.
Further, if you use this runner, it is like old JUnit 3.8 the testsuite should have the suite() method implemented like you have done below.

Coming to your tests, i.e. the class that inherits from TestCase, this is again in the old version. If you use this runner, the @Test is not recognized. You have to follow the old way with setUp() , testxxx() and tearDown() model.

Alternatively you can change you test class model. Remove the inheritance from junit.framework.Testcase and use org.junit.Test annotations. In this case, the annotations are recognized...

The suite should work as it should, if i am not wrong, Alltests should also know the annotations. Please try.

Cheers
Vasu




----- Original Message ----
From: nikhilrmodi <nikhilrmodi@...>
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, January 26, 2007 6:18:46 AM
Subject: [junit] No runnable methods exceptions using JUNIT 4.0 TestSuite with eclipse 3.2.1















Hi,



I am NEW to JUNIT and Eclipse. I have eclipse 3.2.1 that comes with

JUNIT 4.0. I have created a TestSuite using Eclipse wizards. When i

run the TestSuite it fails with



java.lang.Exception : No runnable methods

at

org.junit.internal. runners.TestClas sMethodsRunner. testAborted( TestClassM\

ethodsRunner. java:42)

at

org.junit.internal. runners.TestClas sMethodsRunner. run(TestClassMet hodsRu\

nner.java:33)

at

org.junit.internal. runners.TestClas sRunner$1. runUnprotected( TestClassRun\

ner.java:42)

at

org.junit.internal. runners.BeforeAn dAfterRunner. runProtected( BeforeAndAf\

terRunner.java: 34)

at

org.junit.internal. runners.TestClas sRunner.run( TestClassRunner. java:52)

at

org.eclipse. jdt.internal. junit4.runner. JUnit4TestRefere nce.run(JUnit4Te s\

tReference.java: 38)

at

org.eclipse. jdt.internal. junit.runner. TestExecution. run(TestExecutio n.ja\

va:38)

at

org.eclipse. jdt.internal. junit.runner. RemoteTestRunner .runTests( RemoteTe\

stRunner.java: 460)

at

org.eclipse. jdt.internal. junit.runner. RemoteTestRunner .runTests( RemoteTe\

stRunner.java: 673)

at

org.eclipse. jdt.internal. junit.runner. RemoteTestRunner .run(RemoteTestR un\

ner.java:386)

at

org.eclipse. jdt.internal. junit.runner. RemoteTestRunner .main(RemoteTest Ru\

nner.java:196)



but when i run the individual Test for each class they work fine.



-->>AllTest. java looks like



package com.xxxxxxx. model.domain;



import junit.framework. Test;

import junit.framework. TestSuite;



public class AllTests {



public static Test suite() {

TestSuite suite = new TestSuite("Test for com.xxxxxxx. model.domain" );

//$JUnit-BEGIN$

suite.addTestSuite( ProductTest. class);

//suite.addTestSuit e(ShippingTest. class);

//suite.addTestSuit e(OrderTest. class);

//suite.addTestSuit e(CustEmpTest. class);

//$JUnit-END$

return suite;

}



}



-->>ProductTest. java looks like



package com.xxxxxxx. model.domain;



import junit.framework. TestCase;



import org.junit.Before;

import org.junit.Test;



/**

* JUnit Test Class to test Equals and Validate Method for Product

domain Object

*

*/

public class ProductTest extends TestCase{



@Before

public void setUp() throws Exception {



//super.setUp( );



}



@Test

public void testEquals() {



System.out.println( "starting testEquals() ");



Product p1 = new Product(1,"xxxxxxxx x",50.00, 100,0);

Product p2 = new Product(1,"xxxxxxxx x",50.00, 100,0);



assertTrue(" p1 does NOT equal p2", p1.equals(p2) );



}



@Test

public void testValidate( ){



System.out.print( "starting testValidate( )");



Product p1 = new Product();



assertFalse( "New Product is valid and should not be!",p1.validate( ));



}

}



Please note that i have added the @Test and @Before annotations from the

information i found on web. There where not there initially.



Thanks for Help in Advance.
